channel.title: Crown for player rights 5
channel.description: how do i make it where player rights 5 has a crown?

item.title: Crown for player rights 5
item.dc:creator: @Rufio Rufio
item.description:
@Rufio wrote:

ok you didnt delete the one i said
ok so im assuming your owner acc name is jake
ok so heres what u need to do
Delete both of these codes

if(playerRights == 3) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner and Coder " +playerName+ " has logged out"; } if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jake") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Jake " +playerName+ " has logged out";

And Add one somewhere in that area that says

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jake") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner & Coder " +playerName+ " has logged in";
and if that doesnt work i dont know what to tell you
make sure u compile it after u edit it

Read full topic

item.title: Crown for player rights 5
item.dc:creator: @God11 God11
item.description:
@God11 wrote:

i fixed that now im having trouble with logging out thing when i log out it says member jake logged out but when my cos log it says co owner logde out why dont it say owner and coder jake logged out heres ym code

[code] if(playerRights == 3)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Owner and Coder " +playerName+ " has logged out”;
}
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Jake”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Jake " +playerName+ " has logged out”;
}
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“King Slayer”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Skillz Pl0x”) || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Co-Owner " +playerName+ " has logged out”;
}
else if (playerRights == 2)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Administrator " +playerName+ " has logged out”;
}
else if (playerRights == 1)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Modarator " +playerName+ " has logged out”;
}
else if (playerIsMember == 0)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Non-Member " +playerName+ " has logged out”;
}
else if (playerIsMember == 1)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “Member " +playerName+ " has logged out”;
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Crown for player rights 5
item.dc:creator: @Rufio Rufio
item.description:
@Rufio wrote:

ok so uhm heres what you will probably have to do
Delete this code

else if (playerRights == 3)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner & Coder " +playerName+ " has logged in";

And put this code in its place

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("[b]Owner's account name here[/b]"))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner & Coder" +playerName+ " has logged in";

Change where it says Owner’s account name here to the name of the account that is the owner

reply with your results

Read full topic

item.title: Crown for player rights 5
item.dc:creator: @God11 God11
item.description:
@God11 wrote:

okay well how do i make it where when they log in it says co-owner heres my code

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jake")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "member " +playerName+ " has logged in"; } if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Dumpter Baby") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Mod Brittney")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Jake" +playerName+ " has logged in"; } else if (playerRights == 3) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner & Coder " +playerName+ " has logged in"; } else if (playerRights == 2) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Admin " +playerName+ " has logged in"; } else if (playerRights == 3) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Co-Owner " +playerName+ " has logged in"; } else if (playerRights == 1) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Modarator " +playerName+ " has logged in"; } else if (playerIsMember == 0) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Non-Member " +playerName+ " has logged in"; } else if (playerIsMember == 1) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Member " +playerName+ " has logged in"; }

Read full topic

item.title: Crown for player rights 5
item.dc:creator: @Rufio Rufio
item.description:
@Rufio wrote:

yeah
co-owner is the same as an owner
like co-pilot there still a pilot
co-owner has all the same rights as owner
so yeah.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 21, 2008, 03:41:38 pm[/size][hr]most server have it built in where it says owner and co-owner
the very first account that is made owner will be called owner
and all the rest are called co-owners
